comments:
The following sample contains incorrect code, as the parameter lists
of 'v1' do not match.

class Dummy {             
   int v1(); 
};                                
void Dummy::v1(int par1) { 
}       

When I obtain the binding for the IASTName of the implementation of the
method v1 I get an object of type CPPMethod. 
Calling CPPMethod.getPrimaryDeclaration() results in a ClassCastException.

java.lang.ClassCastException
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.cpp.CPPMethod.getPrimaryDeclaration
(CPPMethod.java:88)

fixed.
The binding for the definition here is now an IProblem binding with id =
IProblemBinding.SEMANTIC_MEMBER_DECLARATION_NOT_FOUND.
Note that even though the method binding is a problem, we still retain the
ability to resolve references to members inside this definition.
class A { void v();  int i; };
void A::v( int ) {   //problem on v
   i++;              //resolves to A::i
}
